intro: Eriogonum purpureum var. tenuius, commonly known as the slenderleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, purple-pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments with minimal water availability.
